/circle6 Place the baby on the mother’s abdomen. (If the baby is not delivered onto the mother’s 
abdomen, make sure there is a warm towel or cloth to receive the baby.)
/circle6 Look for meconium. If there is none, proceed to dry the baby with a warm towel or piece 
of clean cloth. (Do not wipe off   the white greasy substance covering the baby’s body. 
Th is substance, called vernix, helps to protect the baby’s skin.)
